function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Decreased transmission of uv radiation through plastic windows","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Aerosol particle exposure to high uv dose","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to aerosolized virus particles during the experimental protocol","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to virus during the experiment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of laboratory surfaces and equipment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect calculation of tcid 50 and pfu/ml","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential exposure to contagious viruses during experimental studies on virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data and small sample sizes leading to unreliable estimates of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential flaws in statistical analyses and modeling of virus inactivation rate constants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through wearable technology","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on wearable technology for health monitoring","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy and security risks with wearable technology data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of wearables to detect covid-19 symptoms may lead to false positives or false negatives, resulting in incorrect diagnoses.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of wearables data could lead to an overreliance on the technology for decision-making, neglecting other important public health measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Machine learning approaches applied to wearable data could tease out signals of infection or disease states.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long covid symptoms including fatigue, headaches, chest pain, and brain fog can lead to reduced functioning and quality of covid.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wearables to manage symptoms without professional medical oversight","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ethical considerations in repurposing consumer devices for healthcare","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Biosurveillance concerns with wearable devices providing detailed health data","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wearables accentuating anxiety over sleep habits","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data privacy and security issues","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Commercial risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on wearables for healthcare access","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The indoor spread of covid-19 due to reduced outdoor ventilation and increased social interactions in cooler weather.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Concerns about more transmissible variants of covid-19
